name: S&E highest degree holders who are working involuntarily part time or out of field, by S&E degree field: Selected years, 2010–19
description: S&E highest degree holders who are working involuntarily part time or out of field, by S&E degree field: Selected years, 2010–19

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

notes: The involuntarily out-of-field rate is the proportion of all employed individuals who report that their job is not related to their field of highest degree because a job in their highest degree field was not available. The involuntarily working part-time rate is the proportion of all employed individuals who report that they are working part time because a full-time job was not available.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, Scientists and Engineers Statistical Data System (SESTAT), 2010, 2013, and the National Survey of College Graduates (NSCG), 2015, 2017, 2019.Science and Engineering Indicators
